Analysis of New York City Cab data

 

In this excursion I examined the New York City Cab dataset, which can be found at the NYC opendata homepage. The database table stores attributes such as drop off and pickup times, fare amounts, tips given, the type of payment used,....

My approach was twofold. First I imported the database-data using a Java script, and the Socrata Java API.

The final data analysis has been done using R scripts you can find here.

One glimpse at the analysis

I used the GPS data of the taxi pickup location and used the absolute value as norm to assign the taxi rides to the nearest town area. In a next step I filtered the data for the region and computed the mean value of trip distance by trip time to arrive at a simple chart giving the average speed of a cab in the region of interest:

Unsurprisingly the cabs are fastest in the Bronx and Washington Heights, far from the busy city center and slowest in Chelsea, where roads are narrow and traffic is high.

As this is an ongoing effort there is much more to be following here in the next few days.
